value:
In times of invasion, the many tribes
shall unite as one to ensure their
survival. So state the laws of Sacae.

A disaster looms... A dark flame,
consuming all. It is my task—my
burden—to stop the burning.

So long as Dayan, the Silver Wolf, can
bear his fangs, no foe can claim any
foothold upon Sacaen lands.$k$pFor that, I am proud to be his son.

Pay me no mind. I've been fighting
alone, out of formation, since I was
young. I find it easier at this point.

In times of bountiful harvest, all shall
pray to the land and stars at sunrise.
So state the laws of Sacae.

I am Rath of the Kutolah. I dwell with
$Nf...for now.
By wrath of Father Sky!
By voice of Mother Earth!

I am the son of Dayan, the Silver
Wolf. Trifles such as this matter little.

I suppose this deserves to be put
to proper use. Very well, then.

I am Rath of the Kutolah, son of
Dayan, the Silver Wolf. My life and
limb are devoted to my people.

A prophecy foretold a dark flame,
consuming all, and a child born to
stop the burning... Me.$k$pI was very young, but I heeded the
words of the diviner, leaving the
Kutolah to wander the world alone...$k$pI have yet to discover what this "dark
flame" could be, but coming here has
taught me one thing, at least.$k$pNo matter the world, there are always
those who rebel against Mother Earth
and Father Sky.$k$pIf my destiny is to stand against such
foes so disaster might be averted,
then I shall do so by your side.
ふん！
てやっ！
ぐっ…
ばかな…！
You should have walked away.
Forgive me.
By the guidance of the wind!
A thousand curses upon you!
How...regrettable...
Hmmm...
I am Rath of the Kutolah. Son of Dayan, the Silver Wolf.
Wh-what...? If you’ve no business with me, I’m leaving.

A Sacaen warrior proudly defends his own.
We do not abandon our brethren.
I left the Kutolah before I was old enough to understand the true strength of the tribe. For fifteen years now, I've traveled by myself.

I was told that I was born into my land to stop the burning...
A dark flame, consuming all.
I no longer fear the pain of being alone… Though I do remember how it feels.
May the blessings of Mother Earth be upon you...
Sure
Let's make it so.
For the sky and earth.
